quotes.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: One thing only I know, and that is that I know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Ignorance is the root and stem of all evil.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Happiness lies in virtuous activity, and perfect happiness lies in the best activity, which is contemplative.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: People are frugal in guarding their personal property; but as soon as it comes to squandering time they are most wasteful.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Don't seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will—then your life will flow well.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: I think, therefore I am.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.text: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.text: Two things fill the mind with ever new and increasing admiration and awe: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.text: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Meditation brings wisdom; lack of meditation leaves ignorance.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: If you miss the present moment, you miss your appointment with life. That is very serious!
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: Breathing in, I calm body and mind. Breathing out, I smile. Dwelling in the present moment I know this is the only moment.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: A superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Love is the bridge between you and everything.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Do not feel lonely, the entire universe is inside you.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: When walking, walk. When eating, eat.
quotes.author: Zen Proverb

quotes.text: Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Compassion is not complete if it does not include oneself.
quotes.author: Allan Lokos

quotes.text: Philosophy is a battle against the bewitchment of our intelligence by means of language.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.text: The best way to capture moments is to pay attention. This is how we cultivate mindfulness.
quotes.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quotes.text: Nature has given us two ears, two eyes, and but one tongue—to the end that we should hear and see more than we speak.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Necessity is the mother of invention.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: Existence precedes essence.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins beneath one's feet.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: What you seek is seeking you.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: We cannot change anything until we accept it.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response.
quotes.author: Viktor Frankl

quotes.text: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
quotes.author: Viktor Frankl

quotes.text: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances.
quotes.author: Viktor Frankl

quotes.text: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: The obstacle is the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: If it is not right, do not do it. If it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Wherever a man can live, there he can also live well.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: The only thing I know is that I do not know anything.
quotes.author: Socrates
